question: Will the Air Quality Index in Los Angeles be 65 or higher on November 18th?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the AQI in Central Los Angeles for November 18th is equal or higher than 65, and “No” otherwise. 

The resolution source will be AirNow - U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's project, measuring and reporting Air Quality Index, 
https://www.airnow.gov/?city=Los%20Angeles&state=CA&country=USA. The data used is by clicking “Recent Trends”, and hovering over Nov 18th under the bar chart titled “Week” at the check time. 

The check time will be at 12:00 PM ET, November 19, 2021.

question: Will it be sunny in Washington DC at noon on November 16th?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the level of solar radiation as measured by The Washington Post weather station on November 16th at 11:59 AM ET is equal to or higher than 500 (watts/m²) and ""No"" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market is https://www.wunderground.com/dashboard/pws/KDCWASHI185/table/2021-11-16/2021-11-16/daily, under the table column titled “Solar” for the day of November 16, 2021. Data recorded for 11:59 AM ET, or the earliest time available after 11:59 AM ET if its data isn't available, will be used to resolve the market. 

The check will be at 3:00 PM ET, November 16, 2021.

question: Will the high temperature in New York's Central Park be 60°F or higher on November 15th, 2021?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the maximum air temperature measured on November 15th by the National Weather Service in Central Park Area, NY, is 60°F or higher, and ""No"" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market is NOWdata, published by National Weather Service, published on their website: https://www.weather.gov/wrh/Climate?wfo=okx.

The check will be at 10:00 AM ET November 16, 2021.

question: NBA: Will the Nets beat the Magic by more than 9.5 points in their November 10th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for November 10th:

If the Brooklyn Nets win by over 9.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Orlando Magic lose by less than 9.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 17, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Which cryptocurrency will have higher market cap on November 18th: Cardano ($ADA) or Solana ($SOL)?
description:
This is a market on the Market Cap comparison of two cryptocurrencies: Cardano ($ADA) and Solana ($SOL) for the resolution date and time of November 18, 2021, at 8:00 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be market cap ranking on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en). 

If, according to the resolution source, $ADA has a greater market cap than $SOL on the resolution date,  this market will resolve to “Cardano”. If $SOL has a greater market cap than $ADA on the resolution date, this market will resolve to “Solana”. If the estimated market cap for the resolution date is exactly the same for both cryptocurrencies, this market will resolve 50/50.

If for any reason the resolution data is unavailable at the resolution time, another credible source will be checked such as CoinMarketCap. In the event of an ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, historical market caps of each coin will be used (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/cardano, https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/solana), precisely the first recorded measurement after 8:00 PM.
--------------
Market Cap = Current Price x Circulating Supply

Refers to the total market value of a cryptocurrency’s circulating supply.

question: Will a picture surface of Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson kissing before November 30th, 2021?
description:
This is a market on whether the real picture of Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson kissing each other appears on the Internet before November 29th 2021, 11:59:59 PM ET.

This market will resolve “Yes” if the credible news sources publish a real picture or footage with a clear mouth-to-mouth kiss between Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson before the resolution time, and "No" otherwise.

If they have kissed prior to the market creation date (November 10), but the picture or footage surfaces before the market resolution time, the market will still resolve to "Yes."

The Staged kiss for The Saturday Night Live from October does not count.

The resolution source for this market will be any credible news report or social media profiles of the aforementioned celebrities.

question: Will Claude Monet’s “Nymphéas (fragment)” (Lot 1C) sell for more than $1m at Christie’s on November 11?
description:
This is a market on the hammer price of Claude Monet’s “Nymphéas (fragment)” (Lot 1C), scheduled to go up for auction at Christie’s The Cox Collection: The Story of Impressionism, Evening Sale, on November 11, 2021.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the final hammer price at auction exceeds $1 million, and “No” otherwise. 

Please note, the market resolves on the final hammer price at the live auction, which does not include buyer’s premium, fees, or taxes, and is not equivalent to “price realized” as listed on Christie’s website.

Please note, if the final hammer price equals $1,000,000.00 - this market resolves to "No".

-------------------------

The collection and its sale is presented online at Christie's website: https://www.christies.com/en/auction/the-cox-collection-the-story-of-impressionism-evening-sale-20376-nyr/

The auction will be transmitted live on Christie's Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BpkbPBEQb2c
